H0.text: Chloroplasts are the green cell structures of a leaf that are visible under a high‑power microscope.

H1.text: Fibroblasts are the green cell structures of a leaf that are visible under a high power microscope.

H2.text: Golgi apparatus are green cell structures of a leaf that are visible under a high‑power microscope.

H3.text: Veins are the green cell structures of a leaf that are visible under a high‑power microscope.

A4.text: Using a light microscope, it is just barely possible to see tiny green granules—which were named grana.

A5.text: All green parts of a plant contain chloroplasts as the color comes from the chlorophyll.
